candidates.title: Use `SecretBox` for all secret values
candidates.body:
Wrap more secrets in `SecretBox`.

Keeping this PR as a draft, given it depends on a pre-release candidate for `secrecy` (see [this issue](https://github.com/iqlusioninc/crates/issues/1208)).

 When `crypto-bigint` v0.6 is released we can address one more `TODO` ([this one](https://github.com/dvdplm/synedrion/blob/a0e96237dbe75a0fa28dc1c28fefface0eb5b143/synedrion/src/paillier/keys.rs#L176)). 

Fixes #77

candidates.title: Bump `bincode` and `secrecy` for `no_std` builds
candidates.body:
I've been strugging to use Synedrion as a dependency in a Substrate pallet due to one of
its dependencies pulling in `std` transitively, as mentioned in https://github.com/entropyxyz/entropy-core/issues/961.

Through a bit of digging I found that the `bincode` and `secrecy` dependencies were
pulling in `serde` without disable default features, causing `std` to be pulled in.

I've updated them to the latest releases which use better feature management to allow
`serde` to not be pulled in with default features. Note that the latest releases are
technically pre-releases.

candidates.title: Fix WASM build
candidates.body:
- Add a CI step to test building on the WASM target
- Add the RNG parameter to `Round::verify_message()`. Fixes #105

candidates.title: Use `bip32` for key derivation
candidates.body:
Instead of a homebrew derivation, use BIP-32 standard.

There are some future concerns:
- Generalizing this to any curve as a part of #27. `bip32` will have to be generalized for that as well, since as of 0.5 only supports secp256k1. 
- Initial chain code derivation. See #134.
- Only non-hardened derivation paths are supported, and there is no forward secrecy. See #135.

candidates.title: Add more trait impls to public structures
candidates.body:
- Add `Debug` and `Serialize/Deserialize` to public structures
- Wrap secret values in `Secret` in public structures or impl `ZeroizeOnDrop`. Part of #77, but it's not done yet - have to go through all the internals too.

candidates.title: Remove WASM bindings
candidates.body:
Fixes #84 

After #124 is merged, the bindings become quite useless since they fix the choice of the identity/verifier type, which will likely not be what the user needs. So it's time to let them go, nobody used them anyway, and they only slow down development and testing.

candidates.title: Use a generic identity type throughout without converting to `PartyIdx`
candidates.body:
The main change here is removing the internal `PartyIdx` completely and just parametrizing everything with the identity type. Consequently:
- `HoleVec`s are not needed anymore
- `MappableResult` crutch is not needed
- Public API that previously took vectors/slices of Ids now takes `BTreeSet`s
- The identity type needs to be hashable, and the most convenient thing seems to be to require it to be `Serializable` and use that to hash it. Which leads to removing all specialized `Hashable` impls and just using `Serialize` to hash (with the help of `hashing-serializer`) 
- Fixes #82

Update integer crates to pre-release v0.6

candidates.title: Assorted API cleanup
candidates.body:
- Make `Session` objects `Sync` and add a test for it
- Rename `ShareIdx` to `ShareId` - it is not sequential, so not really an index
- Move CGGMP'21 and WWW'02-specific things to the respective submodules
- Only expose special wrapped types for internal benchmarks, not actual internal structs
- Split key shares and auxiliary info; no more `KeyShareSeed`/`KeyShare` dichotomy
- Add a separate AuxGen protocol for the threshold scenario

candidates.title: Threshold integration
candidates.body: Adds a full integration test for creating and using threshold keyshares.

candidates.title: Merge direct and broadcast messages
candidates.body:
Remove the distinction between direct and broadcast messages at the `Session` level since actual broadcast is not available in real applications. There is still a distinction at the typed level, since we may need to echo-broadcast, and we don't want to broadcast (or save to use in the malicious behavior proofs later) the direct part. 

Consequently, the direct and the broadcast part of the message are now bundled at the `Session` level and received by the node simultaneously, simplifying the processing. In particular, this change allowed us to move message verification to `verify_message()` from `finalize()` in several places, thus removing the need in `FinalizeError::Provable` and the whole `ReceiveError` (since `verify_message()` can only return a provable error now). 

Also added `displaydoc` usage for errors; fixes #88

Fixes #52 (to the extent we can until trait specialization is stabilized) - using macros `no_broadcast_messages` and `no_direct_messages`)
Part of #62 (broadcasts and direct messages are now bundled)

candidates.title: Process TODOs: file issues, remove, or resolve
candidates.body:
Also some things were fixed on the spot:
- packed `Bounded` serialization (same as was already the case for `Signed`)
- `HoleVecAccum::finalize()` simplification
- `pow*` functions in `uint.rs` made into `UintModLike` methods
- An unused `Hashable` impl removed
- `FromScalar` impls simplified
- Neater message shuffling in the integration tests

candidates.title: Return `Vec` in WASM bindings natively
candidates.body: Since `wasm-bindgen` 0.2.88 we don't need to go through `wasm-bindgen-derive` anymore. Unfortunately, `Option` is still not supported.

candidates.title: Reduce message sizes
candidates.body:
- Use Bincode instead of MessagePack for internal serialization. MessagePack results in an inefficient encoding of `Uint` values (see https://github.com/RustCrypto/formats/pull/1112, it is currently merged but will take some time to propagate); also Bincode is already used by `entropy-core`.
- Pack `Signed` values before serializing. They are bounded, and the bound is often much smaller than the full size of the integer, so we now serialize only the actual significant bytes.
- The change above leads to a slight variation in message sizes because `Signed::random_bounded_bits_scaled()` could produce numbers with a slightly different bound (because the `scale` is the RSA modulus, which can be either `PRIME_BITS * 2` or `PRIME_BITS * 2 - 1` in size, depending on the value of the RSA primes). This PR changes it to always produce a number with a fixed bound. 

For reference, the message sizes after this PR are:
- Keygen & Aux: 80b, 42kb, 65kb
- Presigning + Signing: 1kb/2kb, 11kb, 2kb, 40b

The reduction is 1.5x-2x compared to the base of the PR (mainly due to replacing MessagePack with Bincode; the packing is much less impactful since most of the size is taken by unbounded integers).

candidates.title: Use an XOF instead of a PRNG to derive ZK proof challenges.
candidates.body:
- This signals the intent better, and XOF implementations have better consistency guarantees. See https://crypto.stackexchange.com/questions/107631/what-is-the-difference-between-a-seeded-rng-and-an-xof-hash for some discussion.
- This fixes the issue with consistency between 32- and 64-bit targets. `crypto-bigint` currently produces a different stream of `Uint`s under certain conditions on 32- and 64-bit targets (see https://github.com/RustCrypto/crypto-bigint/pull/285 for the fix). This PR uses `UintLike::from_xof()` to generate challenges which creates `Uint`s directly from the XOF bytestream.

candidates.title: Message passing rework
candidates.body:
- Now it is possible to have direct and broadcast messages in the same round. Consequently, Presigning now has 3 rounds instead of 4.
- Rounds finalizable to the next round, and the ones finalizable to the result now have separate traits (made exclusive to the extent Rust allows)
- Messages can be created and received in parallel, potentially speeding up the rounds (see the changed integration tests for an example)

candidates.title: Wasm bindings - currently only for make_key_shares
candidates.body:
The key shares are encoded using bincode and given as Uint8Arrays.  This is useful for use-case we have in Entropy, as when a user registers they submit the shares encoded in this way. But there might be use-cases where users want to access properties of `synedrion::KeyShare` - so an improvement would be to offer a non-serialized type as output as well.

I will put bindings for the interactive signing session API in a separate PR.
